com.redhat.rhn.frontend.action.configuration

Class ConfigActionHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.redhat.rhn.frontend.action.configuration.ConfigActionHelper

  • public abstract class ConfigActionHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    BaseCompareFileAction - A base class for doing typical config file request processing.

      • processRequestAttributes

        public static void processRequestAttributes(RequestContext rctxIn)
        Adds the config revision, config file, and config channel as request attributes using the identifiers of the request parameters.
        Parameters:
        rctxIn - The request context which has the request.

      • setupRequestAttributes

        public static void setupRequestAttributes(RequestContext rctxIn,
                          ConfigFile file,
                          ConfigRevision cr)
        Adds the config revision, config file, and config channel as request attributes when we already know the file and rev
        Parameters:
        rctxIn - The request context which has the request.
        file - known config-file
        cr - known revision (null if there isn't one)

      • setupRequestAttributes

        public static void setupRequestAttributes(RequestContext ctx,
                          ConfigChannel channel)
        Adds the config channel info as request attributes when we know the channel Used by the pages that aren't file- and/or revision-specific
        Parameters:
        ctx - The request context which has the request.
        channel - known channel

      • processParamMap

        public static void processParamMap(ConfigChannel cc,
                   java.util.Map params)
        Adds the config channel info to the given map using the identifiers of the request parameters.
        Parameters:
        cc - ConfigChannel of interest
        params - The map in which findings should be stored.

      • processParamMap

        public static void processParamMap(HttpServletRequest request,
                   java.util.Map params)
        Adds the config revision, config file, and config channel to the given map using the identifiers of the request parameters.
        Parameters:
        request - The HttServletRequest to get identifiers from
        params - The map to which findings should be stored.

      • getChannel

        public static ConfigChannel getChannel(HttpServletRequest request,
                       java.lang.String param)
        Finds the config channel with the identifier corresponding with the value of the request parameter with the given name.
        Parameters:
        request - The request to look in for the id (if we're creating a new channel, it might be null)
        param - The name of the id request parameter.
        Returns:
        The sought config channel.

      • getChannel

        public static ConfigChannel getChannel(HttpServletRequest request)
        Finds the config channel with the identifier corresponding with the value of the ccid request parameter.
        Parameters:
        request - The request to look in for the id
        Returns:
        The sought config channel.

      • getFile

        public static ConfigFile getFile(HttpServletRequest request)
        Finds the config file from the cfid request parameter.
        Parameters:
        request - The HttpServletRequest with a cfid
        Returns:
        The found file

      • getRevision

        public static ConfigRevision getRevision(HttpServletRequest request,
                         ConfigFile file)
        Tries to find the revision using a request parameter. Defaults to the newest revision of the given file if it is not found.
        Parameters:
        request - The HttpServletRequest which has a crid parameter
        file - The file this revision should belong to.
        Returns:
        The found revision

      • findRevision

        public static ConfigRevision findRevision(HttpServletRequest req)
        Find the requested REVISION. We have a revision-id as "crid" - but sometimes, we only have a file-id as "cfid". If the latter, find the ConfigFile's latest revision.
        Parameters:
        req - incoming request
        Returns:
        a ConfigRevision, or NULL if we couldn't find one

      • clearRhnSets

        public static void clearRhnSets(User user)
        Clears all of the configuration management sets.
        Parameters:
        user - The user for which to clear the sets.

      • makeFileCountsMessage

        public static java.lang.String makeFileCountsMessage(ConfigFileCount count,
                                     java.lang.String url,
                                     boolean includeAddUrlForEmpty)
        Makes messages that look like 1 file and 5 directories and 0 symlinks 2 files and 1 directory and 0 symlinks No files or directories or symlinks Very standard i18nized counts messages used in various places in config management.
        Parameters:
        count - the ConfigFileCount object, that stores info on the number of files and directories
        url - the url to wrap the messages if so desired
        includeAddUrlForEmpty - include "Add" section for empty
        Returns:
        the properly formatted File & Directories helper messages ..

      • makeFileCountsMessage

        public static java.lang.String makeFileCountsMessage(ConfigFileCount count,
                                     java.lang.String url,
                                     boolean includeEmptyFilesAndDirs,
                                     boolean includeAddUrlForEmpty)
        Makes messages that look like 1 file and 5 directories and 0 symlinks 2 files and 1 directory and 0 symlinks No files or directories and 0 symlinks Very standard i18nized counts messages used in various places in config management.
        Parameters:
        count - the ConfigFileCount object, that stores info on the number of files and directories
        url - the url to wrap the messages if so desired
        includeEmptyFilesAndDirs - force the inclusion of both the file and directory information even if their count is 0. for example: if this param == true return "0 files and 1 directory and 0 symlinks" else return "1 directory"
        includeAddUrlForEmpty - include "Add" section for empty
        Returns:
        the properly formatted File & Directories helper messages ..

      • makeChannelCountsMessage

        public static java.lang.String makeChannelCountsMessage(long count,
                                        java.lang.String url)
        Makes messages that look like 1 channel 2 channels None Very standard i18nized counts messages used in various places in config management.
        Parameters:
        count - the number of config channels
        url - the url to wrap the messages if so desired
        Returns:
        the properly formatted config channel messages
